newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares shed 0.5 pct in profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares shed 0.5 pct in profit-taking.

text.p: Istanbul shares eased slightly in quiet profit-taking on Thursday, amid caution after the recent sharp gains and expectations of strong resistance at 85,000, brokers said.

The IMKB-100 ended at 83,346.09, down 426.23 points, or 0.51 percent from Wednesday's all-time high close of 83,772.33. Trade volume shrank to 16.12 trillion lira ($169 million) from Wednesday's 19.66 trillion ($206.3 million).

"The market was in a waiting mood for most of the day. Selective purchases kept the index at above the 83,000 level because sellers were not very active," said Nermin Samiloglu from Tacirler securities.
Brokers said nine-month profit expectations fuelling selective demand in recent days might ease in coming days as companies announce their figures by Friday the latest.
"I expect the index to ease after testing 85,000 after next week's holiday. Initial support is awaited at 80,000," said Filiz Tiken from Sinai Yatirim ve Kredi Bank.
Turkish markets will be closed on Monday afternoon and Tuesday due to Republic Day holiday.
The index had surged 29.3 percent from September 13 to Wednesday, breaking ten record closes in the strong medium-term uptrend which began with the breaching of 65,000 barrier.
